page.title: 15TEAM SPORTS IN BIBURY
page.content: Bibury Football Team play at their ground near Aldsworth Road.Games are played on Saturdays but the clubhouse is open some evenings.The team originally consisted of players from the parish but today only 6 come from Bibury. The 1st x1 play in the Glos. Northen Semior League and the 2nd x1 for the Cirencester League. Bibury Cricket Club play most summer weekends on Ladyhill. The turf came from Bibury Race Course in 1929. The whole pitch and pavilion were enclosed by a fence in 1974 to protect it from the sheep. Vehicle access was gained in 1985 after 16 years of parking on the old football pitch. The clubs highlight in 1981 was a game versus Warwickshire led by Bob Willis,an England team member, which included most of the Warwickshire team.
